nodes.text: The Vagaari pirate operations were a series of operations that involved Vagaari pirates and the Chiss Ascendancy. While the operations were a success in a military sense, they were a political disaster for the Chiss. Senior Captain Thrawn of the Chiss Ascendancy sustained injuries during the Vagaari pirate operations, and had to undergo physical therapy at the Chiss Expansionary Fleet medcenter on Naporar.

Thrawn's actions against the Vagaari pirates were unauthorized, violating the Ascendancy's non-aggression protocols. Despite Thrawn's successes in eliminating the Vagaari pirates' threat, Syndic Mitth'ras'safis died in the process. Thrawn also lost the chance to salvage "valuable alien technology" from a starship destroyed in the operations, to the displeasure of the Defense Hierarchy Council.
However, Thrawn was able to capture a gravity-well generator from the destroyed ship.

The Defense Hierarchy Council's displeasure at Thrawn for performing the operations without their authorization and losing the Lesser Space technology was later given as the official reason for Thrawn's command of the Springhawk being taken away. However, Supreme General Ba'kif surmised that the real reason was Chiss family politics. Thrawn's campaign had brought honor and glory to the Springhawk, and therefore the Ufsa family wanted one of their own—Ufsa'mak'ro—to command it. Ba'kif figured that the Ufsa family Syndics quietly exchanged favors with members of the Defense Hierarchy Council so Samakro would be given the Springhawk's command. Ba'kif mused that, despite Thrawn's tactical genius, Thrawn had completely missed the politics below the surface in believing the "official" reason he was stripped of the Springhawk.
